'''''Gymnopilus lepidotus''''' is a species of [[mushroom]] in the [[Cortinariaceae]] family.

==Description==
The [[pileus (mycology)|cap]] is {{convert|0.4|to|0.8|cm|in|1}} in diameter.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9">{{cite book |author=Hesler LR. |title=North American Species of ''Gymnopilus'' (Mycologia Memoir Series: No 3) |publisher=Lubrecht & Cramer Ltd |location=Knoxville, Tennessee |year=1969 |pages=40–41 |isbn=0-945345-39-9}}</ref>
;Microscopic characteristics

==Habitat and distribution==
''Gymnopilus lepidotus'' grows on gum logs in Florida, in July.<ref name="isbn0-945345-39-9"/>

==Phylogeny==
This species is in the lepidotus-subearlei grouping.<ref name=Guzman-Davalos2003>{{cite book |vauthors=Guzman-Davalos L, Mueller G, Cifuentes J, Miller AN, Santerre A |title=Tradiational infrageneirc classification of ''Gymnopilus'' is not supported by ribosomal DNA sequence data |journal=Mycologia  |year=2003 |pages=1204–14}}</ref>
